And this all revolves 
around Proposition 64.

Prop 64 is the voter approved
initiative that took effect this

January that legalized 
recreational marijuana for

anyone 21 years or 
older in California.

So most people know or 
have heard about that part.

But a big thing is it also
allows individuals with previous

marijuana convictions to
petition the court to have their
cases dismissed or recalled.

The only potential issue with
that is the petitions can be
costly and time consuming.

So that's California in general
but then on Wednesday

San Francisco District Attorney
George Gascón announced that his

office will be retroactively and
automatically enforcing Prop 64.

This meeting that in 
San Francisco 3,038

misdemeanor marijuana
convictions dating back to 1975
will be dismissed and sealed.

Also another 4,940 felony
marijuana convictions

will be reviewed, 
recalled or re-sentenced.

That said, there are 
some exceptions to this move.

Individuals who 
are repeat offenders,

have committed a violent felony,
are registered sex offenders,

they've sold marijuana to
someone that is under the
